1. Event overview on the map

This is the basic view, which shows all active events on the map. Events within your radius (marked with the green circle) will trigger notification signal on your phone. You can select any event on the map to see the details: picture and comments, and also post comments your self. The size of the radius is adjustable through the Settings menu.

2. Event list and archive

This is a list of events with distance from your current location. You can archive and delete events. Archived events are still available, but they are no longer shown on the map and they no longer trigger notifications.

3. Detail event view with comments

This is where you can see the complete event with comments and photo. You can also add your own comments here.

4. Publish event

You can publish events on any subscribed topic. When publishing, you have to pick a channel and enter a title for the event. Optionally you may set the address manually, change the location, add comment and set a photo.

5. Subscribtions

In the list of channels you can pick those interesting to you in order to receive notifications of events. You can only publish events on subscribed channels.

6. Add new channel

You can add new channels through this option. Adding channels is moderated by system administrators.

7. Event filtering

You can filter the events shown on the map in the event list and in the event archive. Choose filter from the menu or with the filter button on the map and select only the channels you would like to see. You can change the filter any time and the change will reflect on all event views (map, list and archive).

8. Auto archive

Out of date events will be archived by the system. They will no longer appear on the map or in the list of events, they will only be available in the event archive list. You can also archive and unarchive events manually. Unarchived events will never be archived automatically.

9. Settings

Settings menu allows you to:

- set the radius in which you would like to receive notifications of events

- set update period (you can decrease the sum of data transfered over the interntet by setting longer period)

- create a user profile

- set sound and vibrations for notifications

10. Widget

Use TattleTale widget on your phone desktop. Long press on your desktop and choose Widgets in the menu and then select TattleTale. This way, you will always have quick access to sending events, option to refresh data manually from the server and information on aplication statistics.

<font color="#F3F781">TattleTale</font> is completely <font color="#FF0000">free to use</font>. The system uses internet data transfer for which you will be charged by your mobile provider <font color="#FF0000">according to your contract price list.</font> The system doesn\'t use SMS messages.

Use TattleTale to be informed and to inform others about events you see near you. Events are arranged by channels, according to their contents. Subscribe to any channel and you will receive notifications of events sent by other users of the system. You can also publish events on any channel to which you are subscribed and you can comment any event you receive to your phone.

For full functionality of the system you need to be logged in with your user name, which you can create in the settings menu.
TattleTale respects privacy. Any kind of reported privacy violation will be checked and appropriate actions will be taken - either deleting the message and/or banning the user from the system.
TattleTale owners are not responsible for any published contents. Report any kind of violation of privacy to tozibaba.application@gmail.com.
While using TattleTale, respect privacy of others. Any kind of privacy violation will result in banning the violator.
